Articles.Content: OMG , Thank you !!! I was thinking of implementing something like this a week ago but gave up ! You are a lifesaver !
yes serbian thx for all these helpers just great
Fantastic!

I am still excited but it conflicts with some mods, cant figure out which one yet. It breaks the burn indicator and the toolbar mod, and makes the RnD center extremely laggy ! This keeps getting spammed "ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Argument is out of range. Parameter name: index" , first time i see it too !
I uploaded a new version that should suppress the lag and hopefully any other errors.

But if I don't have to research each part individually, what will I do then? Play with spaceships and rockets in KSP? The idea is abhorrent! This is a clicking simulator! THIS IS CLEARLY CHEATING AND DETRACTS FROM THE GAME!

WORSE THAN MECHJEB!!! GAWD! I AM SO MAD! MAAAAADDDD!!!

Finally!

And just like FloorIt, this really needs to be part of the stock command compliment

I too had a problem with this not working. It popped up saying 151 items, click yes and they're all showing researched. Leave the building, go to the VAB and they're unresearched again. I did about 60 by hand and those stay researched, tried the auto method again and it's not working. I have a persistent copy if that would help.

This is the only oddity in the KSP.log

[WRN 22:28:36.082] BorderedTilingSpriteMesh: Mesh has 300 or more vertices and might not be dynamically batched!

[WRN 22:28:36.083] BorderedTilingSpriteMesh: Mesh has 300 or more vertices and might not be dynamically batched!

[WRN 22:28:36.084] BorderedTilingSpriteMesh: Mesh has 300 or more vertices and might not be dynamically batched!

Edited April 28, 2014 by Ratzap
Yes, please put the save somewhere so I can look into it.

Yes, please put the save somewhere so I can look into it.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/71576136/KSP/persistent.sfs

Pic of GameData to show which mods it's using: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/71576136/KSP/mods.jpg

Uber useful! Someone made something like this for me on request a while ago, but this is even better!

Edited April 29, 2014 by KvickFlygarn87
Great, where do I put it?
Anywhere in gamedata.
thank you so much!

It seems that researched parts aren't saved as 'researched' upon exiting the R&D building.. Research all, "yes", exit R&D, enter R&D, I get the option to research all again.

I'd post the output/log and KSP.log but neither are of any use (just the same "[WRN 22:35:05.372] BorderedTilingSpriteMesh: Mesh has 300 or more vertices and might not be dynamically batched!" already posted and that's a warning, not an error).

It seems that researched parts aren't saved as 'researched' upon exiting the R&D building.. Research all, "yes", exit R&D, enter R&D, I get the option to research all again.

I'd post the output/log and KSP.log but neither are of any use (just the same "[WRN 22:35:05.372] BorderedTilingSpriteMesh: Mesh has 300 or more vertices and might not be dynamically batched!" already posted and that's a warning, not an error).

Confirmed I have this as well. I was hoping this was the answer to adding NovaPunch to my Career save too Guess I will either have to bite the bullet and click a million times, or wait for this to update ...

I just updated it and it works with Ratzap save now, so it should be OK for all

I still don't understand how it would works for some and not for other, but the new code should works for everyone.
Working for me now too
I'm still mad. MAD I SAY. How dare you ruin perfect clicking-work for the rest of us! Or something. Where's the challenge? Or something.
Well, I've been waiting too long for this...Merci

I've never felt the need for this, but I've always thought it was something obviously desirable.

Cheers, sarbian, for adding yet another should-be-stock mod to the list.
Halleluja! Seriously, thank you for this. MAN I needed this DLL.
hero! thanks so much

Sarbian wins KSP.

Lets all move on with our lives...

Sarbian wins KSP.

Lets all move on with our lives...

Seconded.

i had gotten to the point where i just kept a backup of a starter career mode persist file with however much science points i've accrued to spend, and would overwrite my current one whenever i added a mod with a lot of parts... (is it just me or is the mousewheel scroll effed up for everyone when it comes to the research facility and tech windows?)
